6.25.18  9:24 am   do you have other job besides making videos?

     making songs

6.25.18  9:07 am   I need a bit of help. Every time I try starting a new project, I think it's going to be great and wonderful. I do in fact start it, however I just stop in the middle of making it and never finish it. Sometimes I even think of a new project that I want to make and completely scrap the old one. Then I get stuck in a loop of half-doing projects.

A third of my computer are now WIP projects that I'm never going to finish. It's quite horrible, but I never really delete them because I think to myself "I'll do it once. I'll finish all of them". I never do, and I just continue filling my computer with half-done projects.

Is there a way for me to stop doing this? I haven't finished a single project for many months, even though I want to do it.

      do data backups and make sure they are all saved. there is very little that is stopping you from developing the skill of rescuing. you could start by getting a text file and making a chronological list of all of them, with brief notes on what you think they need for the next step. be open to the possibility of item cancellation at this stage, but expect most of them to not be cancelled

6.25.18  7:46 am   Can you help with depression or anxiety?

     i don't really know anything about depression. anxiety is more my area of expertise

6.25.18  7:08 am   6.24.18  7:56 am what are some things you learned while mixing the song

      i micromanaged a record breaking number of eq points on the vocal. normally i only manage 1 point but this time i did 15. i did it in the car, because i was just sick of the volatile eq experience in the car. so pretty much every word is eq'd individually so it doesn't boing out weird in the car. i think there are expensive machines that some how do this automatically but i don't have them

      sure, or perhaps too hard to be quality at the expense of being original

6.25.18  12:17 am   people are having trouble with the audio when they listen with vs without headphones?? I've never had that problem when I listen to your music. I can hear all of the audio just fine.

      if you listen to it through a phone speaker, tablet speaker, or laptop speaker, you can't hear any of the bass, or any of the low frequencies whatsoever. it's just not there. it's physically impossible on a speaker of that size. any normal sized speaker would be just fine, but on a speaker less than 1cm, mostly what you hear is a lot of S and T, and the hi-hat, and maybe a little more if you listen close, but zero bass. which is why i think i would like to start the recording of my next song without any bass frequencies, just to make sure i get the thing so that i think it's strong enough even with zero bass. Then, go in and add bass as needed, for bass-capable systems. but first make sure it completely stands strong with no bass. we all know it's possible, like i said, they made music for game boy and it was damn good. and when i say gameboy i mean also millions of phone apps, and ringtones, that have been popular since then. but if you design the whole song on a system where you can hear the bass, you're taking a risk, because you never know if the song is still gonna be strong enough if you delete the entire bass. i've taken that risk for my entire career because i'm mostly too scared to think about it. but i think it's a good time to try to take care of it because phone/tablet speakers aren't going to get any larger, and there is no technological breakthrough any time soon that will allow bass to exist at that size. but don't worry, i will go into bass mode and additively put the bass where it needs be, after i get it so it is solid basslessly

6.24.18  10:05 pm   where did you get all this fucking wisdom??

     it grows on trees!

      it's insane, i'm scrolling through the questions page, and it's some random stuff, and there's some silly stuff, and there's some music stuff, and then there's a pretty deep idea expressed pretty clearly that i've heard from some uni psychology professor on youtube, or from some of freuds books, or sth like that (and i know you aint bothering with any of that, at least based on your answers here)


so i guess my question is, where's the fountain of knowledge man?? i always kinda assumed they don't let you get to it before youre 50 or so. at least it looked that way. like you need time to let some realizations that make sense to you on a rational level sink in in order to be able to *feel* them... so... how? 

     you can build a knowledge farm

6.24.18  8:53 pm   i got this big book on jazz theory and i don't know if it's worth reading. i mean i know that all the information in it is bound to be really useful but reading it seems so tedious and unfun. im just wondering if i could get this same knowledge from just learning tunes i like and analyzing why i like them, while still having fun, although i feel like there may be some things that ill miss from only doing that that i could learn from the book. which one should i do, or should i do both?

     songs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

      how did you learn this stuff?

     songs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

      what are your thoughts on learning by the book?

     how about a song book. as many song books as you can find. even try songs that are not in the book... you can make a book, for those ones! hours of fun

      thanks and sorry if im unclear
